definition:
Given a sheaf $\mathcal F$ on a topological space $X$ and a pair
$(\mathcal F^\bullet, d^\bullet)$ where
$\mathcal F^\bullet = \{\mathcal F^q\}_{q\in\mathbb N}$ is a family of
sheaves on $X$ and $d^\bullet=\{d^q\}_{q\in\mathbb N}$ is a family of
sheaf morphisms $$d^q\colon\mathcal F^q\to\mathcal F^{q+1},$$ we say
that $(\mathcal F^\bullet, d^\bullet)$ is a *resolution* of $\mathcal F$
if there exists an injection $j\colon\mathcal F\to\mathcal F^0$ such
that the sequence
$$0\to\mathcal F\overset{j}\to\mathcal F^0\overset{d^0}\to\mathcal F^1\overset{d_1}\to\cdots\to\mathcal F^q\to\dots$$
is exact.
